results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, focusing on examining and revising assumptions in existing theoretical models of affect dynamics using data from Crystal Island. (e.g., 'This study seeks to re-examine our theoretical models...')

The document provides a step-by-step description of the study design, including the context (Crystal Island), learners, automated detectors of affect, and the use of Ordered Network Analysis (ONA). (e.g., Sections 3.1, 3.2, 3.3)
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available.
While there is no mention of data sharing, there is also no explicit justification for why the data cannot be shared.
There is no mention of a data dictionary or codebook explaining variables, formats, and preprocessing steps.
Data collection methods are fully described, including the use of BROMP observations and pre/post-surveys. (e.g., Section 3.2, 3.1)
The document does not state that the analysis code is shared in an open repository.
There is no justification provided for why the code cannot be shared.
The document does not mention whether code for data preparation is shared.
Statistical tests (ONA, L-statistic) and models are described, along with their underlying assumptions. (e.g., Section 2.3, 2.4, 3.3)

Effect sizes are discussed in relation to the meta-analysis results (Table 1), and statistical significance is mentioned. (e.g., 'only one theorized transition is significantly above chance in more than half of the studies')
While the study interprets findings, it does not employ traditional qualitative research methods with in-depth subjective context.
There is no mention of data coding or qualitative analysis methods.
Results are clearly presented in tables (e.g., Table 1, Table 2, Table 3) and through descriptions of the ONA findings. (e.g., Section 4.1, 4.2)
Limitations are discussed, such as the inability of the BROMP detectors to differentiate between types of frustration and the need for further investigation. (e.g., Section 5.3)
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration.
